v.v: Here are more wise sayings of Solomon that were written down by the men of Hezekiah, the king of Judah.
God honors himself when he hides something so people cannot know it.
What kings think is above the way peasants think; they are like the heavens, they are above us all;
Silver cannot be used by the metal worker,
just as the dross is removed, even so, if wicked men are removed from the kings court,
When you stand in front of a king, do not bring attention to yourself
It is better if someone important invites you, saying, “Come up and sit closer to the king,”
you should not quickly bring the matter to trial,
If you and your neighbor are having a disagreement,
for others might find out what you have done,
Use the right words and a phrase put together to say exactly what you mean;
When a wise person rebukes someone who is willing to listen to him,
A messenger who is reliable and on time, gives delight to those who sent him,
When someone boasts about a gift he is going to give, but never gives it,
With patient persuasion even a ruler’s mind can be changed,
If you find some honey, eat just a little,
Do not go to your neighbor’s house too often;
To falsely accuse others in court
Depending on an unreliable person during times of trouble
Singing a song to someone who is feeling sad,
If your enemies are hungry, give them something to eat;
that will be the equal to pouring coals of fire on his head, without doing him any harm,
When wind blows from the north, it will certainly rain;
It is better to live alone in the corner of a housetop
When you receive news from a far away country,
A good person who falls before the wicked,
It is not good to eat too much honey;
A person who cannot control himself
When it snows in the summer, or when it rains in the harvest,
A sparrow flies here and there flittering around, and a swallow darts back and forth when it flies,
A horse needs a whip to make it move, and a donkey must have a bridle in its mouth, or it will not carry its load.
Do not reply to a fool when he is trying to draw you into his foolishness,
Give a fool an answer that will be just as foolish as his question,
If you entrust an important message to be delivered by a fool,
A lame man cannot use his legs; they hang down and are useless,
When you tie a stone into a sling so it cannot be thrown,
When a drunk man picks up a bush full of thorns
An archer who aims and shoots arrows at people standing around him,
When you see a dog return to his vomit,
Do you know someone who has this idea about himself—
The lazy person has many reasons for not working—
When you see a door swing back and forth on it hinges,
One who is lazy might reach down with his hand to get some food,
The one who is lazy considers himself to be very wise,
Someone who walks by a dog lying on the ground, who then reaches down and pulls its ears;
Who is like an insane person who shoots burning arrows in every direction?
The fire goes out when there is no more wood to burn;
As charcoal can ignite into burning coal and a log of wood into a fire;
The gossip tells stories that are like sweet treats to eat;
A shining glaze applied with great heat, covers the clay pot,
The one who is filled with hate, by the words he speaks, he hides his true feelings;
He may speak kind words, but you should not believe them,
Even though he covers up his hatred by his lies,
One who digs a pit will fall into it;
The one who lies hates the people he destroys;
Do not boast about what will happen tomorrow,
Do not praise yourself; let someone else praise you.
If you think about how heavy a stone can be, or how much sand can weigh—
If you think about how cruel can be people who rage at others, and how angry people can attack others like a flood of water,
It is better to offer a rebuke out in the open, than to have a love that is hidden.
A wound from a friend is better than kisses from an enemy.
When a person is walking along and he has a full stomach, he may step on a honeycomb because he is not hungry;
When a man wanders away from his home,
The aroma of perfume and the scent of incense can help to make a person feel happy;
Do not forget your friend or a friend of your father;
My son, if you become wise, you will make me happy;
One who has good sense takes cover when he sees trouble coming,
Take a man’s garment as security when he is guaranteeing a loan for a stranger.
Whoever shouts out a blessing in a loud voice early in the morning,
A wife who continually argues with her husband is as annoying as
and stopping her from arguing would be as difficult as restraining the wind,
Iron is used to sharpen an iron blade, just like a man makes his friend better.
The farmer who takes care of a fig tree will enjoy its fruit when it is ripe.
When a person looks in the water, he sees his own face;
You know that the Place of the Dead and The Destroyer are never satisfied;
Silver is refined in a crucible, and gold is put into a furnace to be made pure;
Though you grind a fool as if you were grinding up grain,
A good shepherd will know the condition of all his sheep and he will check on them every day.
Wealth does not last forever.
The grass dies out and then the new growth starts to grow;
The lambs will give you warm clothing and the goats will give you enough to pay for the cost of the field.
There will be milk from the goats that you can drink—that will be food for everyone who lives in your house—
A wicked person runs away even when no one is coming after him,
The more sin there is in a country, the greater the number of rulers it will have;
When a poor person oppresses other poor people,
Those who reject the law are the same people who speak well of those who are wicked;
As difficult as it is for evil people to understand what is just,
It is better to be honest and poor,
The one who obeys the law is a child who has understanding of the ways of wisdom;
The person who becomes rich by charging a high rate of interest ,
If you refuse to hear what the law says to you about how you should live;
If someone tricks an honest person into doing that is bad,
A rich person can think of himself as being wise,
When those who do what is right have a victory, it is a time to celebrate,
The one who tries to cover up his sins will be found out,
How fortunate are those who always honor Yahweh;
You know what a roaring lion or a charging bear is like;
A king who does not have good sense thinks he is wise when he is cruel and he takes everything away from his people.
If a person is guilty of murdering another
When a person lives his life and is blameless, Yahweh will keep him safe;
A farmer who works his field will have plenty of food to eat;
Yahweh will give good things to a faithful person;
It is bad to give a favor to one person and not to another;
A man who hates to spend his money will run to more,
The one who rebukes a person will later be appreciated more
Anyone who steals things from his father or his mother
A greedy person stirs up arguments between people;
One who depends on himself is a fool,
One who gives to help the poor, will not lack anything,
When wicked people get power, men and women hide;
When you rebuke a person who has rejected your words and who refused to listen to you,
When people live the right way, they become more numerous,
A son who desires to learn about wisdom makes his father very happy;
When a king rules with honest rules and good laws, he causes his nation to be strong,
One who praises his neighbor to get something from him,
A bad person sets a trap with his sin; then he falls into it;
The one who does right stands up for the poor and defends them;
People who sneer and mock others are like those who set a city on fire;
If a wise person has any conflict with a foolish person,
A murderer hates him who does everything right;
A fool shows all his anger,
If a ruler believes the lies that are told to him,
What do a poor person and one who takes advantage of people have in common?
If a king judges the poor by listening to the truth,
If a child is punished,
When wicked people have authority, lawbreaking is common;
Discipline your child and he will help you and serve you;
When no prophet receives any vision from Yahweh, the people go out of control,
Talk to a slave as much as you want,
Do you see someone who is quick to speak, quick to give an opinion?
If a slave is excused from his labor
A person who cannot control his anger stirs up many quarrels
Any person who is proud will be humbled;
A person who helps a thief, hates himself;
When one is afraid of what people can do,
Many people want to come before a ruler to get help from him,
Those who do what is right detest a person who treats others in an unfair way;

v: But it is to the honor of kings to search out the things that God has hidden.
and all kings have the same deep burdens that others cannot understand.
unless the silver is heated and dross is removed from it;
his throne will be more secure, and he will be able to do what is right.
and do not stand in the place set aside for those the king is honoring.
than to embarrass you in front of an important nobleman by making you move so that you now sit far away from the king.
When you witness something that gives you concern,
unless you are very sure about it.
because your neighbor may have a good explanation for what you saw.
settle it between yourselves, and do not tell others any secret you have learned about;
and you would be ashamed;
and from that time on, you will have a bad reputation.
this is as delightful as seeing designs of gold in a silver bowl.
it is as priceless as a gold ring or jewelry made of finest gold.
to them he is like the cold of snow at harvest time, that refreshes the ground.
he is like the clouds and the wind that do not bring rain.
like the proverb that says, ‘a soft tongue can break a bone.’
because if you eat too much, you could vomit it up.
he may get tired of you, and if you do not stop, he could even grow to hate you.
is like attacking them with a club used in battle, or with a sword, or with sharp arrows.
is like having a bad tooth or a foot that slips and makes you fall.
it is as unhelpful as taking off a coat on a very cold day,
or pouring vinegar into soda, making it bubble.
if they are thirsty, give them something to drink;
and Yahweh will reward you for doing that.
it is just as certain that someone who tells secrets about others will make people angry.
than inside a house with a wife who always wants to argue with you.
that is like giving cold water to a person who is thirsty.
that is as bad as a spring that becomes muddied or a fountain that becomes polluted.
that is like searching for more honor when you already have honor.
is like a city with no way to keep out enemies; its walls have fallen down.
